SEARCH
Module PacMan
Package scripts

Class GameEvents

java.lang.Object
scripts.GameEvents
public class GameEvents extends Object
The GameEvents class handles various game mechanics and events in the JPacMan game, such as spawning ghosts, checking for game over conditions, teleporting characters through portals, and determining victory states.
Since:
1.2.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Davide Di Stefano

  • Method Details

    • ghostSpawner

      public void ghostSpawner(Ghost[] ghosts, GUI userGui, int ghostSpawnerCooldown)
      Spawns ghosts at designated intervals and updates the game state. Ghosts are spawned in sequence, with each ghost being added to the game when the cooldown timer resets. The method also provides a warning message to the player when ghosts are about to appear. Ghosts are positional in the array that contains them
      Parameters:
      ghosts - An array of Ghost objects representing the enemies in the game.
      userGui - The GUI object used to update the game UI.
      ghostSpawnerCooldown - The cooldown timer that determines when ghosts are spawned.
      See Also:
      • Game.ghostSpawnerCooldownReset()
      • GUI.updateLifesLabelText(String)

    • checkGameOver

      public void checkGameOver(PacMan pacman, Ghost[] ghosts, Timer gameClock, GUI userGui, int invincibleModeCooldown, int lives, String[][] gameBoard)
      Checks if Pac-Man has lost by verifying collisions between Pac-Man and ghosts. If Pac-Man collides with a ghost, lives are reduced, and characters are teleported to their default positions. If no lives remain, the game clock stops, and a "GAME OVER" message is displayed.
      Parameters:
      pacman - The PacMan object representing the main character.
      ghosts - An array of Ghost objects representing all ghosts in the game.
      gameClock - The primary game timer, running three times per second to process events.
      userGui - The GUI object used to update the game UI.
      invincibleModeCooldown - The cooldown timer for Pac-Man's invincibility mode.
      lives - The number of lives remaining for Pac-Man.
      gameBoard - The 2D array representing the game board layout.
      See Also:
      • Ghost.removeGhostIcon(String[][])
      • Character.getCoordinatesXY()
      • Character.getCoordinatesXY()
      • CharacterActions.teleportAt(String[][], int[])
      • Game.ghostSpawnerCooldownReset()
      • Game.killedGhostScoreIncrease()
      • GUI.updateLifesLabelText(String)

    • PortalTeleport

      public void PortalTeleport(String[][] gameBoard, PacMan pacman, Ghost[] ghosts)
      Teleports Pac-Man and ghosts when they reach a portal. If a character enters Portal A, they are transported to Portal B, and vice versa.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - A 2D array representing the game board layout.
      pacman - The PacMan object controlled by the player via arrow keys, teleported upon reaching a portal.
      ghosts - An array of Ghost objects, each checked for portal interactions to ensure proper teleportation.
      See Also:
      • method to teleport or reset ghosts

    • checkVictory

      public boolean checkVictory(PacMan pacman, Ghost[] ghosts, GUI userGui, String[][] gameBoard)
      Checks whether the player has achieved victory by scanning the game board for remaining food tiles. If no food squares ("." characters) are found, the game state resets to its initial configuration. Here are modified just ghost and pacMan the board is resetted in the Game class. Upon victory, The game board is reloaded from a file using MatrixExtractor from MatrixFromFileExtractor. The positions of Pac-Man and all ghosts are reset to their default coordinates. A prize tile ("f") is added to grant the player an extra life.
      Parameters:
      pacman - The PacMan object representing the player's character, used to reset its position and direction upon victory.
      ghosts - An array of Ghost objects, each representing an enemy ghost, referenced to reset their positions when the game state is reset.
      userGui - The GUI object used to update the game UI.
      gameBoard - The 2D array representing the game board layout.
      Returns:
      true if the victory condition is met; false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Game.resetGameBoard()
      • Game.resetGameBoard()
      • Character.getCoordinatesXY()
      • CharacterActions.teleportAt(String[][], int[])
      • Game.ghostSpawnerCooldownReset()
      • Ghost.removeGhostIcon(String[][])
      • GUI.updateLifesLabelText(String)
